marketNews.title: President Prabowo suggests scrapping regional elections
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto on Thursday (12/12) proposed eliminating regional elections (pilkada) because the elections are costly. He suggested that regional heads be selected by the DPRD, similar to the process during the Suharto era. It is unclear whether the proposal will become regulation. Political analyst Yoes C. Kenawas told Reuters that the proposal is unreasonable and could set back democracy in Indonesia, as pilkada remains the best way for the public to ensure accountable regional leaders.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia intervenes aggressively to support rupiah
marketNews.content: The Head of Monetary Management and Securities Asset Department of Bank Indonesia, Edi Susianto, told Bloomberg that the central bank has carried out aggressive intervention to curb the rupiah's decline, which is approaching the psychological level of IDR 16,000 per USD. On Friday (13/12) the rupiah weakened to IDR 16,008 per USD before closing down 0.43% at IDR 15,995 per USD. Edi said the weakness was driven by global sentiment, a strong US dollar and geopolitical tensions. The rupiah has depreciated more than 5% this quarter, according to Bloomberg.

marketNews.title: ECB cuts policy rate by 25 basis points to 3.15%
marketNews.content: The European Central Bank on Thursday (12/12) decided to cut its policy rate by 25 basis points to 3.15%, in line with consensus expectations. This is the fourth rate cut in 2024 and reflects an improving inflation outlook, with inflation projected to fall to 2.4% in 2024, 2.1% in 2025 and 1.9% in 2026. Nevertheless, borrowing costs remain tight because previous rate hikes still affect existing loans. The ECB also projected slower economic recovery than previously expected, forecasting GDP growth of 0.7% in 2024, 1.1% in 2025 and 1.4% in 2026.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Industry Minister says no Apple factory plans
marketNews.content: The Minister of Industry, Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita, said there is no plan from Apple Inc. (Nasdaq: AAPL) to build a factory in Indonesia, so the government will not grant permission for the sale of iPhone 16. His statement came a few days after the Minister of Investment and Downstream, Rosan Roeslani, claimed that Apple had committed to invest USD 1 billion in Indonesia in 2026.

marketNews.title: Schroders seeks buyer for Indonesian unit
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that Schroders plc (LON: SDR) wants to sell its Indonesian business as part of the new CEO Richard Oldfield's plan to trim underperforming investment manager units. Previously, Kontan reported in October 2024 that PT BNI Asset Management (BNI AM) planned to acquire PT Schroder Investment Management Indonesia (Schroders Indonesia) from Schroders plc. The sale price was said to be USD 100 million, about 20-25 times Schroders Indonesia's EBITDA. No further developments have been reported, and BBNI's clarification to the IDX in October 2024 neither confirmed nor denied the rumor.

marketNews.title: Wahana Interfood Nusantara opens new chocolate plant in Sumedang
marketNews.content: Wahana Interfood Nusantara (COCO) has opened a new factory in Sumedang Regency, West Java. The plant, covering 9,000 square meters, has an annual chocolate production capacity of 6,000 tons, raising the company's total production capacity to 20,000 tons per year.

tickerNews.title: CBDK announces IPO with valuation Rp17-23 trillion
tickerNews.content: Anak usaha Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua (PANI), Bangun Kosambi Sukses (CBDK) announced it will carry out an IPO offering up to 566.89 million (10%) new shares at a price range of IDR 3,000-4,060 per share. This implies the IPO targets proceeds of around IDR 1.7-2.3 trillion, with a valuation of approximately IDR 17-23 trillion. CBDK operates in the real estate sector in the PIK 2 area, a joint venture between the Agung Sedayu Group and the Salim Group. CBDK became a subsidiary of PANI after being acquired using a right issue in August 2022. The full prospectus is not yet available. According to CBDK's 1H24 financial report, the company and its subsidiaries and associated entities hold a consolidated land bank of 735.2 hectares, 50% of which is undeveloped. After the IPO, the shareholder structure will be PANI (45.9%), Agung Sedayu Group (22.05%), PT Tunas Mekar Jaya/Salim Group (22.05%) and the public (10%). The market cap valuation at IPO is lower than its NAV of IDR 107 trillion, representing a discount to NAV of about 78-84%. The NAV is considered reasonable due to a landbank premium, including the PIK 2 land. The IPO proceeds will be used for equity investment in an affiliate, PT Industri Pameran Nusantara, to finance a MICE (meetings, incentives, conferences, and exhibitions) building project. The bookbuilding will run from 13-20 December 2024, with the public offering expected on 3-9 January 2025 and listing anticipated on 13 January 2025.

tickerNews.title: ADRO reduces stake in AADI to 15.4%
tickerNews.content: Alamtri Resources Indonesia (ADRO) announced it has transferred 5.8 billion (74.6%) shares of Adaro Andalan Indonesia (AADI) at a price of IDR 5,960 per share between 9-11 December 2024. The total transaction value reached IDR 34.6 trillion. This transaction is part of the initial public offering of AADI shares. After this transaction, ADRO's ownership in AADI fell from 90% to 15.4%. In separate disclosures, Garibaldi Thohir and PT Adaro Strategic Investments also executed AADI PUPS, holding 5.78% and 41.1% respectively.

tickerNews.title: BTN CEO says bank acquisition to be completed in 1Q25
tickerNews.content: Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) President Nixon L. P. Napitupulu said the bank acquisition process will be completed in 1Q25, with the spin-off of its sharia business, BTN Syariah, expected by mid-2025. Previously, in November 2024, BBTN mentioned it was negotiating and drafting a conditional sale and purchase agreement to acquire a small bank, without further details.

tickerNews.title: DOID invests in 29Metals, increasing indirect ownership to 19.9%
tickerNews.content: Delta Dunia Makmur, through its entity Bukit Makmur Mandiri Utama Pte. Ltd., announced it has made a new share subscription (Stage I) in its copper mining subsidiary, 29Metals Ltd. (ASX: 29M), valued at AUD 53.8 million. After this transaction, DOID's indirect ownership in 29Metals via its subsidiary rises to 19.5%. The company plans a Stage II subscription that will raise DOID's indirect ownership to 19.9%. Previously, DOID disclosed total new share subscription in 29Metals of approximately AUD 62.1 million.

tickerNews.title: CLEO targets double-digit sales growth in 2024
tickerNews.content: The CEO of Sariguna Primatirta, Melisa Patricia, said the company aims for double-digit sales growth in 2024, which would allow CLEO to record its all-time high sales. The optimism is supported by historical sales trends that usually strengthen toward year-end, especially as consumer activity outside the home increases during the holiday season.

tickerNews.title: ITMA develops 2.5 mmscfd mini LNG project in East Java
tickerNews.content: The CEO of Sumber Energi Andalan, Rocky Oktanso Sugih, said the company is working on a mini LNG processing project with a capacity of 2.5 mmscfd in East Java. The total investment is about USD 28 million, to be financed through bank loans and third-party lenders. The project is expected to be completed by June 2025, adding approximately USD 3.8 million of annual revenue. The initial LNG output will serve the Central and East Java markets, with later phases targeting West Java and Bali, focusing on small and medium-size industrial customers without pipeline gas access.

tickerNews.title: BIPI bids for waste-to-energy plant, mini LNG and renewable projects
tickerNews.content: The CEO of Astrindo Nusantara Infrastruktur, Ray Anthony Gerungan, said the company is participating in a tender for three projects: (1) a waste-to-energy power plant in Java valued at USD 150 million, with a completed feasibility study; (2) a mini LNG project in Java with a capacity of 10 mmscfd and an investment of IDR 350 billion; and (3) a renewable energy-based project. In the long term, BIPI plans to expand into mid-stream, downstream, and value-added green industry segments.
